meanings.definition: Of or relating to Jesuits or Jesuitism.
meanings.sent1: The jesuitical teachings at the school were based on the beliefs of the Jesuits.
meanings.sent2: The jesuitical influence in the church was evident in the elaborate ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The jesuitical approach to problem-solving involved careful planning and strategy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was jesuitical, hiding her true feelings behind a mask of politeness.
meanings.sent5: The jesuitical nature of the politician's promises made it hard to trust his words.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of Jesuits or Jesuitism; cunning; deceitful.
meanings.sent1: The jesuitical man had a way of twisting words to suit his own agenda.
meanings.sent2: Her jesuitical behavior made it difficult to discern her true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's jesuitical attempt to steal food from the table was both clever and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The jesuitical fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest with its cunning ways.
meanings.sent5: His jesuitical smile hinted at a hidden agenda, making others wary of his motives.
